revision.text:
'''Mariyam Afeefa''' is a Maldivian actress. ==Career== In 2010, Afeefa was featured in Abdul Fahtah's horror film ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' alongside [[Ali Seezan]].{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=11 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100212110900/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} Based on true incidents that occurred in an island of Maldives, she played the role of Thahumeena, a simple-going girl who romantically link ups with a visitor and a ghost who seduce the same person in the shape of Thahumeena. Prior to release the film was marketed to be "full of suspense" and "unique" compared to other mediocre Maldivian horror films. Upon release, the film received mixed reviews from critics; majority of them complaining for having the "same old feeling" of prior horror flicks though the performance were noted to be satisfactory. Despite the mixed reviews, the film witnessed a positive response at the box office, screening a total of twenty two housefull shows in Male', declaring it as a Mega-Hit.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=29 April 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100503053202/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} At the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012, Afeefa received a nomination for the Best Actress category.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Dhivehi |work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} Her first release of 2011, was Mohamed Aboobakuru's critical and commercial failure ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'', where her role in the film was regarded and "unnecessary" and "meaningless". It was followed by her playing the role of Sherin, the gluttonous wife who is after her husband's wealth, in the Moomin Fuad-directed crime tragedy drama ''[[Loodhifa]]''.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5254 |title=Loodhifa; Up-righting the fraternal film industry |language=Dhivehi |work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=15 February 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140902184704/https://sun.mv/5254 |deadurl=no |archivedate=2 September 2014 |accessdate=16 April 2018}} Featuring an [[ensemble cast]], the film deals with current social issues in the society told from different perspectives of the characters.{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |title=Expectations for "Loodhifa" is high |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101216122531/http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2010 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} Made on a budget of [[Maldivian rufiyaa|MVR]] 600,000, the film was declared a commercial failure though it received wide critical acclaim, praising the performance of cast and the film's "realism" in its language, characters and their attitude. At the [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] she was bestowed with her second [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]].{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |title=With 10 awards, "Loodhifa" crowned as Best Film |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=22 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180331061412/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} She also received a nomination for the same category in 2nd Maldives Film Awards.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Dhivehi |work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' | Thahumeena | Nominated—Maldives Film Awards for Best Actress | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Dhin Veynuge Hithaamaigaa]]'' | Herself | Special appearance in the song "Annaashey Hinithun Velamaa" | style="text-align: center;"| {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93295&category=ihUfinum |title=Dhin Veynuge Hithaamaigaa to release on April 5 |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=18 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100221062847/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93295&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=22 September 2018 |accessdate=22 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'' | {{n/a}} | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2011 !scope="row"| ''[[Loodhifa]]'' | Shenin | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]]
Nominated—Maldives Film Awards for Best Actress | style="text-align: center;"|
|- |} ==Accolades== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |- !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Award !scope="col"| Category !scope="col"| Nominated work !scope="col"| Result ! scope="col" class="unsortable"| {{Abbr|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2016 ! scope="row" |5th Gaumee Film Awards | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]] | ''Vaa Loabi Engeynama'' | {{won}} | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2012 ! scope="row" | Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012 | Best Actress | ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' | {{nom}} | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2016 ! scope="row" | [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]] | ''[[Loodhifa]]'' | {{won}} | style="text-align: center;"| |- |} == References == {{Reflist|30em}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Afeefa, Mariyam}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian actresses]] [[Category:Maldivian film actresses]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]]

'''Mariyam Afeefa''' is a Maldivian actress. ==Career== In 2010, Afeefa was featured in Abdul Fahtah's horror film ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' alongside [[Ali Seezan]].{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=11 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100212110900/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} Based on true incidents that occurred in an island of Maldives, she played the role of Thahumeena, a simple-going girl who romantically link ups with a visitor and a ghost who seduce the same person in the shape of Thahumeena. Prior to release the film was marketed to be "full of suspense" and "unique" compared to other mediocre Maldivian horror films. Upon release, the film received mixed reviews from critics; majority of them complaining for having the "same old feeling" of prior horror flicks though the performance were noted to be satisfactory. Despite the mixed reviews, the film witnessed a positive response at the box office, screening a total of twenty two housefull shows in Male', declaring it as a Mega-Hit.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=29 April 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100503053202/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} At the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012, Afeefa received a nomination for the Best Actress category.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Dhivehi |work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} Her first release of 2011, was Mohamed Aboobakuru's critical and commercial failure ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'', where her role in the film was regarded and "unnecessary" and "meaningless". It was followed by her playing the role of Sherin, the gluttonous wife who is after her husband's wealth, in the Moomin Fuad-directed crime tragedy drama ''[[Loodhifa]]''.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5254 |title=Loodhifa; Up-righting the fraternal film industry |language=Dhivehi |work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=15 February 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140902184704/https://sun.mv/5254 |deadurl=no |archivedate=2 September 2014 |accessdate=16 April 2018}} Featuring an [[ensemble cast]], the film deals with current social issues in the society told from different perspectives of the characters.{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |title=Expectations for "Loodhifa" is high |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101216122531/http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2010 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} Made on a budget of [[Maldivian rufiyaa|MVR]] 600,000, the film was declared a commercial failure though it received wide critical acclaim, praising the performance of cast and the film's "realism" in its language, characters and their attitude. At the [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] she was bestowed with her second [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]].{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |title=With 10 awards, "Loodhifa" crowned as Best Film |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=22 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180331061412/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} She also received a nomination in the same category at the 2nd Maldives Film Awards ceremony.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Dhivehi |work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' | Thahumeena | Nominated—Maldives Film Awards for Best Actress | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Dhin Veynuge Hithaamaigaa]]'' | Herself | Special appearance in the song "Annaashey Hinithun Velamaa" | style="text-align: center;"| {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93295&category=ihUfinum |title=Dhin Veynuge Hithaamaigaa to release on April 5 |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=18 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100221062847/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93295&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=22 September 2018 |accessdate=22 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'' | {{n/a}} | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2011 !scope="row"| ''[[Loodhifa]]'' | Shenin | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]]

'''Mariyam Afeefa''' is a Maldivian actress. She has established a career in Maldivian films and is the recipient of several awards, including two [[Gaumee Film Award]]s. ==Career== In 2010, Afeefa was featured in Abdul Fahtah's horror film ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' alongside [[Ali Seezan]].{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=11 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100212110900/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} Based on true incidents that occurred in an island of Maldives, she played the role of Thahumeena, a simple-going girl who romantically link ups with a visitor and a ghost who seduce the same person in the shape of Thahumeena. Prior to release the film was marketed to be "full of suspense" and "unique" compared to other mediocre Maldivian horror films. Upon release, the film received mixed reviews from critics; majority of them complaining for having the "same old feeling" of prior horror flicks though the performance were noted to be satisfactory. Despite the mixed reviews, the film witnessed a positive response at the box office, screening a total of twenty two housefull shows in Male', declaring it as a Mega-Hit.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=29 April 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100503053202/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} At the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012, Afeefa received a nomination for the Best Actress category.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Dhivehi |work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} Her first release of 2011, was Mohamed Aboobakuru's critical and commercial failure ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'', where her role in the film was regarded and "unnecessary" and "meaningless". It was followed by her playing the role of Sherin, the gluttonous wife who is after her husband's wealth, in the Moomin Fuad-directed crime tragedy drama ''[[Loodhifa]]''.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5254 |title=Loodhifa; Up-righting the fraternal film industry |language=Dhivehi |work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=15 February 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140902184704/https://sun.mv/5254 |deadurl=no |archivedate=2 September 2014 |accessdate=16 April 2018}} Featuring an [[ensemble cast]], the film deals with current social issues in the society told from different perspectives of the characters.{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |title=Expectations for "Loodhifa" is high |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101216122531/http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2010 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} Made on a budget of [[Maldivian rufiyaa|MVR]] 600,000, the film was declared a commercial failure though it received wide critical acclaim, praising the performance of cast and the film's "realism" in its language, characters and their attitude. At the [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] she was bestowed with her second [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]].{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |title=With 10 awards, "Loodhifa" crowned as Best Film |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=22 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180331061412/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} She also received a nomination in the same category at the 2nd Maldives Film Awards ceremony.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Dhivehi |work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! It was followed by her playing the role of Sherin, the gluttonous wife who is after her husband's wealth, in the Moomin Fuad-directed crime tragedy drama ''[[Loodhifa]]''.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5254 |title=Loodhifa; Up-righting the fraternal film industry |language=Dhivehi |work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=15 February 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140902184704/https://sun.mv/5254 |deadurl=no |archivedate=2 September 2014 |accessdate=16 April 2018}} Featuring an [[ensemble cast]], the film deals with current social issues in the society told from different perspectives of the characters.{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |title=Expectations for "Loodhifa" is high |language=Dhivehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101216122531/http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2010 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} Made on a budget of [[Maldivian rufiyaa|MVR]] 600,000, the film was declared a commercial failure though it received wide critical acclaim, praising the performance of cast and the film's "realism" in its language, characters and their attitude. At the [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] she was bestowed with her second [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]].{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |title=With 10 awards, "Loodhifa" crowned as Best Film |language=Dhivehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=22 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180331061412/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} She also received a nomination in the same category at the 2nd Maldives Film Awards ceremony.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Dhivehi |work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! '''Mariyam Afeefa''' is a Maldivian actress. She has established a career in Maldivian films and is the recipient of several awards, including two [[Gaumee Film Awards]]. ==Career== In 2010, Afeefa was featured in Abdul Fahtah's horror film ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' alongside [[Ali Seezan]].{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=11 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100212110900/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} Based on true incidents that occurred in an island of Maldives, she played the role of Thahumeena, a simple-going girl who romantically link ups with a visitor and a ghost who seduce the same person in the shape of Thahumeena. Prior to release the film was marketed to be "full of suspense" and "unique" compared to other mediocre Maldivian horror films. Upon release, the film received mixed reviews from critics; majority of them complaining for having the "same old feeling" of prior horror flicks though the performance were noted to be satisfactory. Despite the mixed reviews, the film witnessed a positive response at the box office, screening a total of twenty two housefull shows in Male', declaring it as a Mega-Hit.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=29 April 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100503053202/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} At the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012, Afeefa received a nomination for the Best Actress category.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Divehi|work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} Her first release of 2011, was Mohamed Aboobakuru's critical and commercial failure ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'', where her role in the film was regarded and "unnecessary" and "meaningless". It was followed by her playing the role of Sherin, the gluttonous wife who is after her husband's wealth, in the Moomin Fuad-directed crime tragedy drama ''[[Loodhifa]]''.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5254 |title=Loodhifa; Up-righting the fraternal film industry |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=15 February 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140902184704/https://sun.mv/5254 |deadurl=no |archivedate=2 September 2014 |accessdate=16 April 2018}} Featuring an [[ensemble cast]], the film deals with current social issues in the society told from different perspectives of the characters.{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |title=Expectations for "Loodhifa" is high |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101216122531/http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2010 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} Made on a budget of [[Maldivian rufiyaa|MVR]] 600,000, the film was declared a commercial failure though it received wide critical acclaim, praising the performance of cast and the film's "realism" in its language, characters and their attitude. At the [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] she was bestowed with her second [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]].{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |title=With 10 awards, "Loodhifa" crowned as Best Film |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=22 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180331061412/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} She also received a nomination in the same category at the 2nd Maldives Film Awards ceremony.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Divehi|work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' | Thahumeena | Nominated—Maldives Film Awards for Best Actress | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Dhin Veynuge Hithaamaigaa]]'' | Herself | Special appearance in the song "Annaashey Hinithun Velamaa" | style="text-align: center;"| {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93295&category=ihUfinum |title=Dhin Veynuge Hithaamaigaa to release on April 5 |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=18 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100221062847/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93295&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=22 September 2018 |accessdate=22 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'' | {{n/a}} | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2011 !scope="row"| ''[[Loodhifa]]'' | Shenin | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]]

'''Mariyam Afeefa''' is a Maldivian actress. She has established a career in Maldivian films and is the recipient of several awards, including two [[Gaumee Film Awards]]. ==Career== [[Ahmed Nimal]]-directed erotic horror thriller ''[[Khalaas]]'' was released in 2008 which follows a newly married couple who relocate themselves to [[Sri Lanka]]. Starring opposite [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Nadhiya Hassan]], Afeefa played the role of Sara, a bewildered wife who encounters several supernatural activities.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/index.php/entertainment/11141 |title=Stars faded way too soon |work=Dho? |language=Divehi |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=6 January 2017 |archiveurl=http://archive.is/OVbEH |deadurl=no |archivedate=4 January 2019 |accessdate=4 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}} The film received mixed reviews from critics specific appraisal being subjected to its bold and erotic theme. In 2010, Afeefa was featured in Abdul Fahtah's horror film ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' alongside [[Ali Seezan]].{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=11 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100212110900/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} Based on true incidents that occurred in an island of Maldives, she played the role of Thahumeena, a simple-going girl who romantically link ups with a visitor and a ghost who seduce the same person in the shape of Thahumeena. Prior to release the film was marketed to be "full of suspense" and "unique" compared to other mediocre Maldivian horror films. Upon release, the film received mixed reviews from critics; majority of them complaining for having the "same old feeling" of prior horror flicks though the performance were noted to be satisfactory. Despite the mixed reviews, the film witnessed a positive response at the box office, screening a total of twenty two housefull shows in Male', declaring it as a Mega-Hit.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=29 April 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100503053202/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} At the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012, Afeefa received a nomination for the Best Actress category.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Divehi|work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} Her first release of 2011, was Mohamed Aboobakuru's critical and commercial failure ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'', where her role in the film was regarded and "unnecessary" and "meaningless". It was followed by her playing the role of Sherin, the gluttonous wife who is after her husband's wealth, in the Moomin Fuad-directed crime tragedy drama ''[[Loodhifa]]''.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5254 |title=Loodhifa; Up-righting the fraternal film industry |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=15 February 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140902184704/https://sun.mv/5254 |deadurl=no |archivedate=2 September 2014 |accessdate=16 April 2018}} Featuring an [[ensemble cast]], the film deals with current social issues in the society told from different perspectives of the characters.{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |title=Expectations for "Loodhifa" is high |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101216122531/http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2010 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} Made on a budget of [[Maldivian rufiyaa|MVR]] 600,000, the film was declared a commercial failure though it received wide critical acclaim, praising the performance of cast and the film's "realism" in its language, characters and their attitude. At the [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] she was bestowed with her second [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]].{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |title=With 10 awards, "Loodhifa" crowned as Best Film |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=22 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180331061412/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} She also received a nomination in the same category at the 2nd Maldives Film Awards ceremony.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Divehi|work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2008 !scope="row"| ''[[Khalaas]]'' | Sara | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' | Thahumeena | Nominated—Maldives Film Awards for Best Actress | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Dhin Veynuge Hithaamaigaa]]'' | Herself | Special appearance in the song "Annaashey Hinithun Velamaa" | style="text-align: center;"| {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93295&category=ihUfinum |title=Dhin Veynuge Hithaamaigaa to release on April 5 |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=18 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100221062847/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93295&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=22 September 2018 |accessdate=22 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'' | {{n/a}} | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2011 !scope="row"| ''[[Loodhifa]]'' | Shenin | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]]
Nominated—Maldives Film Awards for Best Actress | style="text-align: center;"|
|- |} ==Accolades== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |- !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Award !scope="col"| Category !scope="col"| Nominated work !scope="col"| Result ! scope="col" class="unsortable"| {{Abbr|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2008 ! scope="row" | [[5th Gaumee Film Awards]] | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress|Best Actress]] | ''Vaaloabi Engeynama'' | {{won}} |style="text-align:center;"|{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/60767 |title=Winners of 5th Gaumee Film Awards |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Ahmed |first=Fazeena |date=13 April 2008 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181221053708/http://webcache.dhivehi.mv/haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/60767 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=21 December 2018 |accessdate=21 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}} |- | 2012 ! scope="row" | 1st Maldives Film Awards | Best Actress | ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' | {{nom}} | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2016 ! scope="row" | [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]] | ''[[Loodhifa]]'' | {{won}} | style="text-align: center;"| |- |} == References == {{Reflist|30em}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Afeefa, Mariyam}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian actresses]] [[Category:Maldivian film actresses]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]]

'''Mariyam Afeefa''' is a Maldivian actress. She has established a career in Maldivian films and is the recipient of several awards, including two [[Gaumee Film Awards]]. ==Career== [[Ahmed Nimal]]-directed erotic horror thriller ''[[Khalaas]]'' was released in 2008 which follows a newly married couple who relocate themselves to [[Sri Lanka]].{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |title=Politics is a challenge to entertainment industry |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Hassan, Nazim |date=22 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160628083248/http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |archivedate=28 June 2016 |accessdate=28 June 2016}} Starring opposite [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Nadhiya Hassan]], Afeefa played the role of Sara, a bewildered wife who encounters several supernatural activities.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/index.php/entertainment/11141 |title=Stars faded way too soon |work=Dho? |language=Divehi |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=6 January 2017 |archiveurl=http://archive.is/OVbEH |deadurl=no |archivedate=4 January 2019 |accessdate=4 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}} The film received mixed reviews from critics specific appraisal being subjected to its bold and erotic theme. In 2010, Afeefa was featured in Abdul Fahtah's horror film ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' alongside [[Ali Seezan]].{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=11 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100212110900/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} Based on true incidents that occurred in an island of Maldives, she played the role of Thahumeena, a simple-going girl who romantically link ups with a visitor and a ghost who seduce the same person in the shape of Thahumeena. Prior to release the film was marketed to be "full of suspense" and "unique" compared to other mediocre Maldivian horror films. Upon release, the film received mixed reviews from critics; majority of them complaining for having the "same old feeling" of prior horror flicks though the performance were noted to be satisfactory. Despite the mixed reviews, the film witnessed a positive response at the box office, screening a total of twenty two housefull shows in Male', declaring it as a Mega-Hit.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=29 April 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100503053202/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} At the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012, Afeefa received a nomination for the Best Actress category.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Divehi|work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} Her first release of 2011, was Mohamed Aboobakuru's critical and commercial failure ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'', where her role in the film was regarded and "unnecessary" and "meaningless". It was followed by her playing the role of Sherin, the gluttonous wife who is after her husband's wealth, in the Moomin Fuad-directed crime tragedy drama ''[[Loodhifa]]''.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5254 |title=Loodhifa; Up-righting the fraternal film industry |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=15 February 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140902184704/https://sun.mv/5254 |deadurl=no |archivedate=2 September 2014 |accessdate=16 April 2018}} Featuring an [[ensemble cast]], the film deals with current social issues in the society told from different perspectives of the characters.{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |title=Expectations for "Loodhifa" is high |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101216122531/http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2010 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} Made on a budget of [[Maldivian rufiyaa|MVR]] 600,000, the film was declared a commercial failure though it received wide critical acclaim, praising the performance of cast and the film's "realism" in its language, characters and their attitude. At the [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] she was bestowed with her second [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]].{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |title=With 10 awards, "Loodhifa" crowned as Best Film |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=22 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180331061412/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} She also received a nomination in the same category at the 2nd Maldives Film Awards ceremony.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Divehi|work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2008 !scope="row"| ''[[Khalaas]]'' | Sara | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' | Thahumeena | Nominated—Maldives Film Awards for Best Actress | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Dhin Veynuge Hithaamaigaa]]'' | Herself | Special appearance in the song "Annaashey Hinithun Velamaa" | style="text-align: center;"| {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93295&category=ihUfinum |title=Dhin Veynuge Hithaamaigaa to release on April 5 |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=18 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100221062847/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93295&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=22 September 2018 |accessdate=22 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'' | {{n/a}} | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2011 !scope="row"| ''[[Loodhifa]]'' | Shenin | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]]

'''Mariyam Afeefa''' is a Maldivian actress. She has established a career in Maldivian films and is the recipient of several awards, including two [[Gaumee Film Awards]]. ==Career== Afeefa made her film debut in [[Ahmed Nimal]]'s romantic film ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' (2006), starred alongside [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Fathimath Fareela]] and [[Fauziyya Hassan]] which was a critical and commercial success, considered to be the most successful Maldivian release of the year.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |title=Top 10 Actresses in Malives |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120305014312/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=5 March 2012 |accessdate=26 November 2018}} The film follows a conflicted husband struggling to convey equal affection towards his two spouses. Her performance as the superlative wife received critical appreciation, winning her a [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress|Gaumee Film Award as the Best Actress]] and a Miadhu Crystal Award as the Best Female Debut.{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/48823 |title=Zuleykha Awarded as Best Film winning in eight categories |language=Divehi| work=Haveeru |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181213115122/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/AaoRm |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 June 2007 |accessdate=12 December 2018}} [[Ahmed Nimal]]-directed erotic horror thriller ''[[Khalaas]]'' was released in 2008 which follows a newly married couple who relocate themselves to [[Sri Lanka]].{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |title=Politics is a challenge to entertainment industry |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Hassan, Nazim |date=22 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160628083248/http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |archivedate=28 June 2016 |accessdate=28 June 2016}} Starring opposite [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Nadhiya Hassan]], Afeefa played the role of Sara, a bewildered wife who encounters several supernatural activities.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/index.php/entertainment/11141 |title=Stars faded way too soon |work=Dho? |language=Divehi |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=6 January 2017 |archiveurl=http://archive.is/OVbEH |deadurl=no |archivedate=4 January 2019 |accessdate=4 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}} The film received mixed reviews from critics specific appraisal being subjected to its bold and erotic theme. In 2010, Afeefa was featured in Abdul Fahtah's horror film ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' alongside [[Ali Seezan]].{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=11 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100212110900/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} Based on true incidents that occurred in an island of Maldives, she played the role of Thahumeena, a simple-going girl who romantically link ups with a visitor and a ghost who seduce the same person in the shape of Thahumeena. Prior to release the film was marketed to be "full of suspense" and "unique" compared to other mediocre Maldivian horror films. Upon release, the film received mixed reviews from critics; majority of them complaining for having the "same old feeling" of prior horror flicks though the performance were noted to be satisfactory. Despite the mixed reviews, the film witnessed a positive response at the box office, screening a total of twenty two housefull shows in Male', declaring it as a Mega-Hit.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=29 April 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100503053202/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} At the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012, Afeefa received a nomination for the Best Actress category.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Divehi|work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} Her first release of 2011, was Mohamed Aboobakuru's critical and commercial failure ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'', where her role in the film was regarded and "unnecessary" and "meaningless". It was followed by her playing the role of Sherin, the gluttonous wife who is after her husband's wealth, in the Moomin Fuad-directed crime tragedy drama ''[[Loodhifa]]''.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5254 |title=Loodhifa; Up-righting the fraternal film industry |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=15 February 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140902184704/https://sun.mv/5254 |deadurl=no |archivedate=2 September 2014 |accessdate=16 April 2018}} Featuring an [[ensemble cast]], the film deals with current social issues in the society told from different perspectives of the characters.{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |title=Expectations for "Loodhifa" is high |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101216122531/http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2010 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} Made on a budget of [[Maldivian rufiyaa|MVR]] 600,000, the film was declared a commercial failure though it received wide critical acclaim, praising the performance of cast and the film's "realism" in its language, characters and their attitude. '''Mariyam Afeefa''' is a Maldivian actress. She has established a career in Maldivian films and is the recipient of several awards, including two [[Gaumee Film Awards]]. ==Career== Afeefa made her film debut in [[Ahmed Nimal]]'s romantic film ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' (2006), starred alongside [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Fathimath Fareela]] and [[Fauziyya Hassan]] which was a critical and commercial success, considered to be the most successful Maldivian release of the year.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |title=Top 10 Actresses in Malives |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120305014312/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=5 March 2012 |accessdate=26 November 2018}} The film follows a conflicted husband struggling to convey equal affection towards his two spouses. Her performance as the superlative wife received critical appreciation, winning her a [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress|Gaumee Film Award as the Best Actress]] and a Miadhu Crystal Award as the Best Female Debut.{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/48823 |title=Zuleykha Awarded as Best Film winning in eight categories |language=Divehi| work=Haveeru |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181213115122/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/AaoRm |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 June 2007 |accessdate=12 December 2018}} [[Ahmed Nimal]]-directed erotic horror thriller ''[[Khalaas]]'' was released in 2008 which follows a newly married couple who relocate themselves to [[Sri Lanka]].{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |title=Politics is a challenge to entertainment industry |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Hassan, Nazim |date=22 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160628083248/http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |archivedate=28 June 2016 |accessdate=28 June 2016}} Starring opposite [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Nadhiya Hassan]], Afeefa played the role of Sara, a bewildered wife who encounters several supernatural activities.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/index.php/entertainment/11141 |title=Stars faded way too soon |work=Dho? |language=Divehi |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=6 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/OVbEH |deadurl=no |archivedate=4 January 2019 |accessdate=4 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}} The film received mixed reviews from critics specific appraisal being subjected to its bold and erotic theme. In 2010, Afeefa was featured in Abdul Fahtah's horror film ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' alongside [[Ali Seezan]].{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=11 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100212110900/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} Based on true incidents that occurred in an island of Maldives, she played the role of Thahumeena, a simple-going girl who romantically link ups with a visitor and a ghost who seduce the same person in the shape of Thahumeena. Prior to release the film was marketed to be "full of suspense" and "unique" compared to other mediocre Maldivian horror films. Upon release, the film received mixed reviews from critics; majority of them complaining for having the "same old feeling" of prior horror flicks though the performance were noted to be satisfactory. Despite the mixed reviews, the film witnessed a positive response at the box office, screening a total of twenty two housefull shows in Male', declaring it as a Mega-Hit.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=29 April 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100503053202/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} At the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012, Afeefa received a nomination for the Best Actress category.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Divehi|work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} Her first release of 2011, was Mohamed Aboobakuru's critical and commercial failure ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'', where her role in the film was regarded and "unnecessary" and "meaningless". It was followed by her playing the role of Sherin, the gluttonous wife who is after her husband's wealth, in the Moomin Fuad-directed crime tragedy drama ''[[Loodhifa]]''.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5254 |title=Loodhifa; Up-righting the fraternal film industry |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=15 February 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140902184704/https://sun.mv/5254 |deadurl=no |archivedate=2 September 2014 |accessdate=16 April 2018}} Featuring an [[ensemble cast]], the film deals with current social issues in the society told from different perspectives of the characters.{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |title=Expectations for "Loodhifa" is high |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101216122531/http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2010 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} Made on a budget of [[Maldivian rufiyaa|MVR]] 600,000, the film was declared a commercial failure though it received wide critical acclaim, praising the performance of cast and the film's "realism" in its language, characters and their attitude. At the [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] she was bestowed with her second [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]].{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |title=With 10 awards, "Loodhifa" crowned as Best Film |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=22 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180331061412/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} She also received a nomination in the same category at the 2nd Maldives Film Awards ceremony.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Divehi|work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2006 !scope="row"| ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' | Aminath Niha | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]] | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2008 !scope="row"| ''[[Khalaas]]'' | Sara | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' | Thahumeena | Nominated—Maldives Film Awards for Best Actress | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Dhin Veynuge Hithaamaigaa]]'' | Herself | Special appearance in the song "Annaashey Hinithun Velamaa" | style="text-align: center;"| {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93295&category=ihUfinum |title=Dhin Veynuge Hithaamaigaa to release on April 5 |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=18 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100221062847/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93295&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=22 September 2018 |accessdate=22 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'' | {{n/a}} | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2011 !scope="row"| ''[[Loodhifa]]'' | Shenin | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]]
Nominated—Maldives Film Awards for Best Actress | style="text-align: center;"|
|- |} ==Accolades== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |- !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Award !scope="col"| Category !scope="col"| Nominated work !scope="col"| Result ! scope="col" class="unsortable"| {{Abbr|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2007 ! scope="row" | Miadhu Crystal Award | Best Female Debut | ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' | {{won}} |style="text-align:center;"| |- | 2008 ! scope="row" | [[5th Gaumee Film Awards]] | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress|Best Actress]] | ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' | {{won}} |style="text-align:center;"|{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/60767 |title=Winners of 5th Gaumee Film Awards |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Ahmed |first=Fazeena |date=13 April 2008 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181221053708/http://webcache.dhivehi.mv/haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/60767 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=21 December 2018 |accessdate=21 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}} |- | rowspan="2"| 2012 ! scope="row" rowspan="2"| 2nd Maldives Film Awards |rowspan="2"| Best Actress | ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' | {{nom}} | style="text-align: center;"| |- | ''[[Loodhifa]]'' | {{nom}} | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2016 ! scope="row" | [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]] | ''[[Loodhifa]]'' | {{won}} | style="text-align: center;"| |- |} == References == {{Reflist|30em}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Afeefa, Mariyam}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian actresses]] [[Category:Maldivian film actresses]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]]

It was followed by her playing the role of Sherin, the gluttonous wife who is after her husband's wealth, in the [[Moomin Fuad]]-directed crime tragedy drama ''[[Loodhifa]]''.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5254 |title=Loodhifa; Up-righting the fraternal film industry |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=15 February 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140902184704/https://sun.mv/5254 |deadurl=no |archivedate=2 September 2014 |accessdate=16 April 2018}} Featuring an [[ensemble cast]], the film deals with current social issues in the society told from different perspectives of the characters.{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |title=Expectations for "Loodhifa" is high |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101216122531/http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2010 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} Made on a budget of [[Maldivian rufiyaa|MVR]] 600,000, the film was declared a commercial failure though it received wide critical acclaim, praising the performance of cast and the film's "realism" in its language, characters and their attitude. At the [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] she was bestowed with her second [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]].{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |title=With 10 awards, "Loodhifa" crowned as Best Film |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=22 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180331061412/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} She also received a nomination in the same category at the 2nd Maldives Film Awards ceremony.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Divehi|work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! '''Mariyam Afeefa''' is a Maldivian actress. She has established a career in Maldivian films and is the recipient of several awards, including two [[Gaumee Film Awards]]. ==Career== Afeefa made her film debut in [[Ahmed Nimal]]'s romantic film ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' (2006), starred alongside [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Fathimath Fareela]] and [[Fauziyya Hassan]] which was a critical and commercial success, considered to be the most successful Maldivian release of the year.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |title=Top 10 Actresses in Malives |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120305014312/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=5 March 2012 |accessdate=26 November 2018}} The film follows a conflicted husband struggling to convey equal affection towards his two spouses. Her performance as the superlative wife received critical appreciation, winning her a [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress|Gaumee Film Award as the Best Actress]] and a Miadhu Crystal Award as the Best Female Debut.{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/48823 |title=Zuleykha Awarded as Best Film winning in eight categories |language=Divehi| work=Haveeru |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181213115122/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/AaoRm |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 June 2007 |accessdate=12 December 2018}} [[Ahmed Nimal]]-directed erotic horror thriller ''[[Khalaas]]'' was released in 2008 which follows a newly married couple who relocate themselves to [[Sri Lanka]].{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |title=Politics is a challenge to entertainment industry |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Hassan, Nazim |date=22 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160628083248/http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |archivedate=28 June 2016 |accessdate=28 June 2016}} Starring opposite [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Nadhiya Hassan]], Afeefa played the role of Sara, a bewildered wife who encounters several supernatural activities.{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/index.php/entertainment/11141 |title=Stars faded way too soon |work=Dho? |language=Divehi |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=6 January 2017 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/OVbEH |deadurl=no |archivedate=4 January 2019 |accessdate=4 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}} The film received mixed reviews from critics specific appraisal being subjected to its bold and erotic theme. In 2010, Afeefa was featured in Abdul Fahtah's horror film ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' alongside [[Ali Seezan]].{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=11 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100212110900/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93070&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} Based on true incidents that occurred in an island of Maldives, she played the role of Thahumeena, a simple-going girl who romantically link ups with a visitor and a ghost who seduce the same person in the shape of Thahumeena. Prior to release the film was marketed to be "full of suspense" and "unique" compared to other mediocre Maldivian horror films. Upon release, the film received mixed reviews from critics; majority of them complaining for having the "same old feeling" of prior horror flicks though the performance were noted to be satisfactory. Despite the mixed reviews, the film witnessed a positive response at the box office, screening a total of twenty two housefull shows in Male', declaring it as a Mega-Hit.{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |title=Positive comment for the film - Its a big achievement |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=29 April 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100503053202/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=95729&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} At the Enchanteur Maldives Film Awards 2012, Afeefa received a nomination for the Best Actress category.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Divehi|work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} Her first release of 2011, was Mohamed Aboobakuru's critical and commercial failure ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'', where her role in the film was regarded and "unnecessary" and "meaningless". It was followed by her playing the role of Sherin, the gluttonous wife who is after her husband's wealth, in the [[Moomin Fuad]]-directed crime tragedy drama ''[[Loodhifa]]''.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5254 |title=Loodhifa; Up-righting the fraternal film industry |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=15 February 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140902184704/https://sun.mv/5254 |deadurl=no |archivedate=2 September 2014 |accessdate=16 April 2018}} Featuring an [[ensemble cast]], the film deals with current social issues in the society told from different perspectives of the characters.{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |title=Expectations for "Loodhifa" is high |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101216122531/http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2010 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} Made on a budget of [[Maldivian rufiyaa|MVR]] 600,000, the film was declared a commercial failure though it received wide critical acclaim, praising the performance of cast and the film's "realism" in its language, characters and their attitude. At the [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] she was bestowed with her second [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]].{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |title=With 10 awards, "Loodhifa" crowned as Best Film |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=22 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180331061412/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} She also received a nomination in the same category at the 2nd Maldives Film Awards ceremony.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Divehi|work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2006 !scope="row"| ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' | Aminath Niha | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]] | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2008 !scope="row"| ''[[Khalaas]]'' | Sara | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Jinni (film)|Jinni]]'' | Thahumeena | Nominated—Maldives Film Awards for Best Actress | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Dhin Veynuge Hithaamaigaa]]'' | Herself | Special appearance in the song "Annaashey Hinithun Velamaa" | style="text-align: center;"| {{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93295&category=ihUfinum |title=Dhin Veynuge Hithaamaigaa to release on April 5 |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=18 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100221062847/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93295&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=22 September 2018 |accessdate=22 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}} |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Mi Hiyy Keekkuraanee?]]'' | Aroosha | | style="text-align: center;"|{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |title=Top 10 Actresses in Maldives |language=Divehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120305014312/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=5 March 2012 |accessdate=26 November 2018 |df=dmy-all }} |- | 2011 !scope="row"| ''Hiyy Vindhaa Nulaa'' | {{n/a}} | | style="text-align: center;"| |- | 2011 !scope="row"| ''[[Loodhifa]]'' | Shenin | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]]

It was followed by her playing the role of Sherin, the gluttonous wife who is after her husband's wealth, in the [[Moomin Fuad]]-directed crime tragedy drama ''[[Loodhifa]]''.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5254 |title=Loodhifa; Up-righting the fraternal film industry |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=15 February 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140902184704/https://sun.mv/5254 |deadurl=no |archivedate=2 September 2014 |accessdate=16 April 2018}} Featuring an [[ensemble cast]], the film deals with current social issues in the society told from different perspectives of the characters.{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |title=Expectations for "Loodhifa" is high |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101216122531/http://haveeru.com.mv/?page=details&id=104588&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2010 |accessdate=3 October 2018}} Made on a budget of [[Maldivian rufiyaa|MVR]] 600,000, the film was declared a commercial failure though it received wide critical acclaim, praising the performance of cast and the film's "realism" in its language, characters and their attitude. At the [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] she was bestowed with her second [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]].{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |title=With 10 awards, "Loodhifa" crowned as Best Film |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=22 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180331061412/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10616 |deadurl=no |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} She also received a nomination in the same category at the 2nd Maldives Film Awards ceremony.{{cite news|url=http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |title=Feature Film Nominations Announced |language=Divehi|work=Maldives Film Awards |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417013119/http://maldivesfilmawards.com/?page=detail&id=34 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=30 March 2018 |accessdate=30 March 2018}} ==Media image== In 2010, Afeefa was voted as the "Most Entertaining Actress" in the SunFM Awards 2009, an award night ceremony initiated by Sun Media Group to honour the most recognized personalities in different fields, during the previous year, while defending the award in the next year.{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/6357 |title=Top 3 Nominations announced for SunFM Awards 2010 |language=Divehi|work=Sun |date=28 March 2011 |archiveurl=http://archive.is/oGWEL |archivedate=16 June 2019 |accessdate=16 June 2019}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes !
